name: Puppet, Baby Piggy, 1984
description: Baby Piggy is a puppet with peach colored face and limbs, blond curly hair, blue eyes, wearing a pink lace-trimmed dress, pink bow, purple gloves, lace booties, and a necklace. She is carrying a doll in the shape of Kermit the Frog.
creator: Frank Oz (Performer) Laurie O'Brien (Performer) Michael Frith (Designer)
historic_note: Baby Piggy is a puppet that is a baby version of Muppet Miss Piggy that was originally created for the "I'm Always Gonna Love You" musical sequence in the film The Muppets Take Manhattan(1984), which featured baby versions of Miss Piggy, Kermit, Rowlf, Fozzie, Gonzo, and Scooter. This movie sequence became the inspiration behind the commercially successful animated children's television show Muppet Babies(1984-1991).
credit: A Gift From the Family of Jim Henson
